item.title: About
item.description: I am currently a postdoc and a member of the CO3 or Consciousness, Cognition & Computation Group at the CRNC. I also work as a philosophy tutor at the Max Planck School of Cognition. Before coming to Brussels, I worked in the Situated Cognition Research Group at the Ruhr-Universität Bochum, where I also carried out my doctoral research under the supervision of Tobias Schlicht and Daniel Dennett. In my dissertation I investigated the way in which the computational models developed within the framework of predictive processing constrain the space of possible mechanisms underlying perceptual experience and whether the framework can yield a new perspective on the nature of consciousness.
